subject: RE: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... How do you mean they are very different? In both cases, JUnit will invoke fragileInit() before every test method. ... No, same remark as above:
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

> ... and the following two are very different ....
>
> public class Test {
> private ExpensiveResource bigObject;
>
> public Test() {
> bigObject = ExpensiveResource.fragileInit();
> }
>
> ====
>
> public class Test {
> private ExpensiveResource bigObject;
>
> protected void setUp() throws ItFailedException {
> bigObject = ExpensiveResource.fragileInit();
> }
>

How do you mean they are very different?

In both cases, JUnit will invoke fragileInit() before every test method.

> ... and these two will have different behavior ....
>
> public class Test {
> private GlobalResource resource;
>
> public Test() {
> resource = GlobalResource.init();
> }
>
> ====
>
> public class Test {
> private GlobalResource resource;
>
> protected void setUp() {
> resource = GlobalResource.init();
> }

No, same remark as above: GlobalResource.init() will be invoked before
every test method.
